ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: That day it will narrate its annals,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: On that Day it will relate all her news,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: On that day the earth will declare all (the activities of the human being) which have taken place on it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: On that day earth will narrate its news,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: That Day it will declare its information.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: On that day she shall tell her news,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: upon that day she shall tell her tidings
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: That day she will relate her chronicles,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: on that Day it will narrate its account,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: On that Day she will tell out the tidings thereof.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: On that day she will relate her chronicles
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: On that Day will she declare her tidings:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: That Day it will declare its information (about all what happened over it of good or evil).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: On that Day it shall proclaim its news,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: On that Day, it will tell its tales.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: That Day, it will report its news
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [99:4] On that day (yawma’idhin substitutes for, and is the response to, idhā, ‘when’) it shall relate its chronicles, it shall inform of the good and evil deeds committed in it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (That day) when the earth is shaken (she will relate her chronicles) the earth will inform about the good and evil that were done on its surface,
